Dating: 25TH DYNASTY AND CONTEMPORARIES (not before); 26TH DYNASTY (not after)
Name: Outer coffin of Pe-de-amenemope
Description: The wooden coffin is covered with stucco and painted. On the chest is an ornate collar and a representation of a winged scarab. Underneath are registers with representations of gods and columns of text with offering prayers. The wig is decorated with a fillet. The underside has been left white. Around the exterior runs a single line of text. On the bottom of the inside of the box, Ptah-Sokar-Osiris is depicted on a standard. On each side is a bearded serpent wearing a white crown with ostrich feathers. This outer coffin forms a set with an inner coffin, which is also kept in the Vienna museum (Ã„OS 217).
